sub_title: Driving Social Impact across the Opportunity Global Network
summary:
Calum has a passion for applying expert, professional experience and innovative, effective approaches to adding value for diverse stakeholders across different working cultures. Areas of expertise:

•	Program strategy development and leadership
•	Design and delivery of social impact measurement frameworks
•	Promoting use of performance management systems across multiple stakeholders
•	Presenting social impact to investors, donors and other expert and non-expert audiences
•	Application of economic analysis and social research
•	Climate change risk mitigation and adaptation in the Financial Inclusion sector

•	Experience in public sector, finance and development fields.

profile_positions.description: Developing a network wide Climate Change strategy for Opportunity International. Considering the impact of climate change across our 40 partners and 6m+ clients. Assessing how we can adapt our global strategy, partnerships and products and services to reduce our carbon footprint and build climate resilience in the vulnerable clients and communities that we serve.
profile_positions.title: Strategy Lead - Climate Change and Microfinance

profile_positions.description:
Global leader of Opportunity's program for measuring and enhancing social impact across 40 microfinance partners in 20 countries, delivering value for three key stakeholders:

•	Partner CEOs and management teams:  Working with them to deliver evidence-based improvements in the effectiveness of the financial, education, and other services that they provide
•	Opportunity’s 4m clients:  Improving outcomes for clients through promoting the use of data collected to better understand and serve their needs 
•	Opportunity’s donors and investors:  Providing innovative and compelling publications on the impact of Opportunity’s investments, and partner programs 

Achievements:

•	Promoted a culture of valuing social data and using data in decision making within Opportunity’s global management and across the Opportunity network 
•	Overseen the implementation of over 400 best practices across partners in Latin America, Eastern Europe, Africa and Asia (India, Philippines, Indonesia) 
•	Led the design and publication of Opportunity’s first Social Performance report, an innovation in the sector. This has become an annual publication, making a significant contribution to Opportunity’s global fundraising 
•	Contributed to promoting best practice in the microfinance sector through written and public presentations 
•	Reviewed and developed strategies for improving Opportunity’s healthcare and education outcomes in deprived areas of India
profile_positions.title: Global Impact Director

profile_positions.description:
Core Responsibilities 

Develop Social Performance Management (SPM) strategy for Opportunity International Network partners to ensure monitoring and reporting on social performance for the benefit of clients, partner MFIs and other stakeholders globally.

Develop strategies and policies to assist Opportunity International Australia’s partners in the field. Manage long-term projects in support of both microfinance and complementary development programs.

Communicate policy and strategy to donors to assist fundraising through communication to donors, and to inform staff and other stakeholders, through presentations at both private and public events:
http://masterclass.gofundraise.com.au/
profile_positions.title: Program Impact Director

profile_positions.description:
Core Responsibilities		

Develop and manage Opportunity's Social Performance Management (SPM) project for India. This project is key to assessing the organisation's performance, and thus critical to raising funds and ensuring the success of Opportunity in India. 

Develop strategies for improving the healthcare and education outcomes of poor people in deprived areas of India. 

Develop a strategy for the impact of the Global Economic Crisis on Microfinance. 

The Research Project Manager role requires management of people and resources both in Australia and in India, developing partnerships with organisations here and in country, and promoting Opportunity International as a leading global provider of Microfinance. 

Key Achievements

Developed an evaluation framework for seven India-based microfinance partners in my first six months as project manager on SPM.. 

Developed a health micro-insurance product for poor microfinance clients in India, managing input from a team of actuaries from Deloitte-Trowbridge 

Developing a product that would be effective and practical on the ground in India required a real commitment to bringing together research and experience from a range of diverse stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Research Project Manager

profile_positions.description: In his role as a Board member of the Social Performance Taskforce, Calum was a respected contributor to emerging best practice across the microfinance sector. Calum continues to engage with the leading standard setting and capacity building institutions in the microfinance sector and is committed to driving evidence based service-delivery and innovation in microfinance.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description: As a volunteer consultant to Opportunity International, I helped design a project to assess the impact that Opportunity has on its clients, researched and wrote a report on the prospects for microfinance in India, and designed an evaluation strategy for Opportunity's marketing events. This was a voluntary post of 30 hours per week for four months.
profile_positions.title: Economic Advisor and Technical Report Writer

profile_positions.description:
Core Responsibilities		

Lead economic advisor to Cabinet Ministers, policy makers and health sector senior management on the costs and benefits of pay modernisation programmes and value for money of major (£5m+) capital investment projects. 

Developed and implemented guidelines on the appraisal and evaluation of health policies across Scotland. Provided general advice on cost-effectiveness in health. 

Key Achievements

Joint team-leader on a project to model the financial impact of 'Agenda for Change', the largest single pay-contract ever introduced in Scotland. Produced an innovative IT-based model now in use by all 15 Scottish Health Boards. 

Co-author of a study to evaluate the impact of the 2006 Public Smoking Ban in Scotland. This study is regarded as the most comprehensive study of smoking restrictions ever undertaken.
profile_positions.title: Economic Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Core Responsibilities	

Team Leader of a team appraising applications for business support grants of £2m-25m. Liaised with multinational companies and advised senior management and Cabinet Ministers on cost-effectiveness. Assisted in final grant decisions. 

Lead economic advisor to policy makers on the knowledge economy in Scotland, looking particularly at the contribution of R&D to private-sector productivity. 

Key Achievements

Assessed grant applications totalling over £50m for projects involving over £250m of capital investment.  Helped develop policy on business support grants in Scotland.

Wrote technical papers on the knowledge economy in Scotland, on inward investment, and on regional development policy for the Scottish economy.
profile_positions.title: Economic Advisor

profile_positions.description: Provided economic advice to policy makers and Ministers on transport policy in Scotland. Project manager on major transport policies including competitive tender of subsidised ferry services and evaluation of the economic impact of the Skye Toll Bridge. Joint author of published papers on the whisky and textiles industries. Assessed the economic impact on the Scottish economy of major firm openings and closures.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Economist

company.name: Belize Council for the Visually Impaired (BCVI) - Belize, Central America

volunteer_experiences.description: In this role, I designed and implemented a management accounting system for a NGO in Belize. In spite of its low turnover, this charity served over 100,000 poor people in Belize each year. Since completing the project, the management accounting system and accompanying report have been used by BCVI to lobby donors for increased funding, and to plan a future expansion to provide improved eye-care services to a greater number of poor individuals across Belize. This was a full-time voluntary post in Central America for three months.
